div.p: Breeding success (chicks per female) of capercaillie ( a) and black grouse ( b) plotted against how many days that hatching time was off the date of GDD 5 = 200 (hatched vertical line). Early and late hatching are negative and positive values, respectively. In capercaillie, the best fitted line was a second-order polynomial function: y = 1.31 + 0.005 x − 0.004 x 2; R 2 = 0.15; p = 0.02. Black grouse was best fitted with a first-order function: y = 2.075 − 0.025 x; R 2 = 0.09; p = 0.06.
